extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor to create an instance of the board. Creates an 8x8 array for the chess board

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public pieces.Pieces[][] getBoard()
        Method to return the chess board
        Returns:
        board

      • atPosition

        public pieces.Pieces atPosition(pieces.Position p)
        Method to get the piece that is at the position on the board specified.
        Parameters:
        p - Position specified
        Returns:
        Pieces piece at position parameter

      • populate

        public void populate()
        Method to populate board with pieces at their correct starting positions.

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Method which prints out the chess board.

      • maintainPawn

        public void maintainPawn()
        Method to maintain all the pawn pieces and their justMovedTwo fields. This is necessary to execute after every time a player makes a move to turn off justMovedTwo fields after the opponent's turn if the pawn has just moved two up.

      • isUnderAttack

        public static boolean isUnderAttack(pieces.Pieces piece,
                                    pieces.Position p,
                                    Board board)
        Checks if position is under attack by opponent of the player calling this method. Method mostly for checking if the King is in check.
        Parameters:
        piece - Player's piece to refer to color to know who is opponent
        p - Position to test if under attack
        board - Current board
        Returns:
        true if the position is under attack

      • getPositionKing

        public pieces.Position getPositionKing(java.lang.String color,
                                       Board board)
        Gets position of king of same color as piece calling this methodical method.
        Parameters:
        color - To refer to to get correct king
        board - Current board
        Returns:
        Position of the King of interest

      • getBoardPosition

        public pieces.Position getBoardPosition(int file,
                                        int rank)
        Returns position corresponding to file and rank parameters.
        Parameters:
        file - File for position
        rank - Rank for position
        Returns:
        Position specified by file and rank
